org.araneaframework.uilib.flowcontext.transitionhandler
Class CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.framework.container.StandardFlowContainerWidget.StandardTransitionHandler
      org.araneaframework.uilib.flowcontext.transitionhandler.CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, FlowContext.TransitionHandler
public class CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler
extends StandardFlowContainerWidget.StandardTransitionHandler

FlowContext.TransitionHandler with some special confirmation handling for org.araneaframework.framework.FlowContext#TRANSITION_CANCEL events. It attaches event listener to active flow when its cancellation request is received and asks user to confirm the action whenever the predicate shouldConfirm evaluates to true.

Since:
1.1
Author:
Taimo Peelo (taimo@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:

Constructor Detail

CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler

public CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler(Predicate shouldConfirm,
                                         String confirmationMessage,
                                         boolean allCancellings)
Initializes a new transition handler that displays given confirmationMessage if predicate shouldConfirm returns true. By default, this transition handler responds to FlowContext#TRANSITION_CANCEL. If allCancellings is set to true then this transition handler also responds to every other transition type, except FlowContext#TRANSITION_START and FlowContext#TRANSITION_FINISH.

Parameters:
shouldConfirm - The predicate that is used to check whether confirmation should be shown.
confirmationMessage - The message to show if the predicate returns true.
allCancellings - If true then transition type may be either FlowContext#TRANSITION_CANCEL , FlowContext#TRANSITION_REPLACE, or FlowContext#TRANSITION_RESET. Otherwise, only FlowContext#TRANSITION_CANCEL is monitored.
Since:
1.2.2

CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler

public CancelConfirmingTransitionHandler(Predicate shouldConfirm,
                                         String confirmationMessage)
Initializes a new transition handler that displays given confirmationMessage if predicate shouldConfirm returns true. By default, this transition handler responds to transitions of type FlowContext#TRANSITION_CANCEL.

Parameters:
shouldConfirm - The predicate that is used to check whether confirmation should be shown.
confirmationMessage - The message to show if the predicate returns true.
